title: [K-12] Strategic Choice Approach (SCA) Workshop for Reconstructing Language Curriculum: Focused on Text, Vocabulary, and Communicative Competence

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in curriculum development and management, comprehension of higher education policies, foundational skills in language education curriculum design, and understanding of text analysis and vocabulary selection methodologies
context.additional_context: A scenario-based language curriculum redesign process for corporate settings requiring stakeholder consensus. Reflects core language education elements (text analysis, vocabulary selection, communication skills) and emphasizes curriculum design for improving reading comprehension, writing, and expression.

learning_goals: When reconstructing language curricula using the SCA methodology, learners can design consensus-building strategies among stakeholders and incorporate text analysis and vocabulary selection criteria.
Through conflict situation analysis, learners can systematically prioritize language curriculum development and make decisions that enhance communication skills.

Using online collaboration tools, learners can systematically collect language education requirements from large stakeholder groups and perform data analysis reflecting goals for improving grammar, reading comprehension, and expressive skills.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
